module.name: FileUtil
module.short: Miscellaneous procedures, functions, types, and classes for manipulating files and file names

descr.p: This unit contains functions, procedures, types, and classes used to maintain compatibility with the FileUtil unit in Delphi. File routines that deal with UTF-8 file names are located in the LazFileUtils unit.

File name handling in the unit is platform- or OS-specific. For the Windows, Darwin (MacOS), and Amiga platforms, file names are NOT case sensitive. In addition, under Darwin, the NotLiteralFilenames define is enabled. This indicates that file names cannot be compared using the = string operator.

This unit contains basic functions similar to those in the RTL, but use UTF-8 instead of the defauilt system encoding. Please note that AnsiToUTF8 and UTF8ToAnsi need a widestring manager under Linux, BSD, and MacOSX. Normally these OS's use UTF-8 as system encoding so the WideStringManager is not needed.

element.name: UTF8FileHeader
element.short: Byte Order Mark (BOM) used at the beginning of UTF-8-encoded files

element.name: FilenamesCaseSensitive
element.short: When True, uppercase and lowercase file names are treated as equivalent
element.descr: The value is determined by the presence of the CaseInsensitiveFilenames compiler define.

element.name: FilenamesLiteral
element.short: When True, file names can be compared using the = string operator
element.descr: The value is determined by the presence of the NotLiteralFilenames compiler define.

element.name: CompareFilenames
element.short: CompareFileNames - compares two file names to see whether they are equal

element.name: CompareFilenames.Result
element.short: Returns zero if files are equal, or the index of differences, or the difference in length if filenames are not equal

element.name: CompareFilenames.Filename1
element.short: First filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.Len1
element.short: Length of first filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.Filename2
element.short: Second filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.Len2
element.short: Length of second filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.ResolveLinks
element.short: ResolveLinks - if True, searches through links to find the actual file for comparison

element.name: DeleteDirectory
element.short: DeleteDirectory - Delete the named directory (or only its contents if OnlyChildren is True)
element.errors: If there was an error, such as trying to removing . or .., or there were insufficient permissions, or the file did not exist, False is returned

element.name: DeleteDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns True if the directory or its contents were correctly removed

element.name: DeleteDirectory.DirectoryName
element.short: The name of the directory for processing

element.name: DeleteDirectory.OnlyChildren
element.short: If True, only the contents ('children') of the directory are removed

element.name: ProgramDirectory
element.short: ProgramDirectory - returns the directory in which the currently running program resides

element.name: ProgramDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns the name of the directory in which the current program is found

element.name: FileSize
element.short: FileSize - finds the size of the named file

element.name: FileSize.Result
element.short: Returns the size of the file, or -1 if not there

element.name: FileSize.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FilenameIsPascalUnit
element.short: FilenameIsPascalUnit - checks that the supplied name is a correct Pascal unit name

descr.p: FilenameIsPascalUnit - checks that the supplied name is a correct Pascal unit name. It examines the file extension to see if it matches one of the standard Pascal extensions (currently .p, .pp, .pas).

element.name: FilenameIsPascalUnit.Result
element.short: Returns True if the supplied name is a correct Pascal Unit filename

element.name: FilenameIsPascalUnit.Filename
element.short: The name of the file to examine

element.name: FileIsInPath
element.short: FileIsInPath - checks that FileName refers to a file that exists within the given Path

element.name: FileIsInPath.Result
element.short: Returns True if a file named Filename exists within the given Path

element.name: FileIsInPath.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FileIsInPath.Path
element.short: The Path to be searched

element.name: FileIsInDirectory
element.short: FileIsInDirectory - checks whether a file with FileName exists within the given Directory

descr.p: FileIsInDirectory - checks whether a file with FileName exists within the given Directory.

element.name: FileIsInDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns True if the file is in the directory

element.name: FileIsInDirectory.Filename
element.short: The name of the file to be checked

element.name: FileIsInDirectory.Directory
element.short: The name of the directory to be searched for the file

element.name: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt
element.short: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt - returns just the name of the file without an extension

element.name: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt.Result
element.short: Returns the original file name if it had no extension, otherwise returns the file name with its extension removed

element.name: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath
element.short: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath - concatenates BaseDirectory and SearchPath to form an absolute path to search for files

descr.p: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath - concatenates BaseDirectory and SearchPath to form an absolute path to search for files.

The routine adds the appropriate path delimiters to the BaseDirectory string, and adds the search path. Each directory in the search path is examined to ensure that each is also an absolute directory path. The return value contains the fully-formed absolute search path.
If BaseDirectory is empty, the function exits with a return value equal to SearchPath. if SearchPath is empty, the function exits with empty string ('') in the return value.
Deprecated. Use the CreateAbsoluteSearchPath function from the LazFileUtils unit.

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath.Result
element.short: The absolute path formed by concatenating BaseDirectory and SearchPath

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath.SearchPath
element.short: The search path (a relative path)

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath.BaseDirectory
element.short: The base directory from which to form the absolute path

element.name: CreateAbsolutePath
element.short: Deprecated
element.descr: Deprecated. Use the function from the LazFileUtils unit.

element.name: GetAllFilesMask
element.short: File mask representing all files suitable for showing in a file filter.
element.descr: GetAllFilesMask returns a File Mask suitable for showing in a filter of a Open File Dialog. For Windows, '*.*' is returned; on other operating systems just '*'.

element.name: GetExeExt
element.short: GetExeExt - find the correct extension (including the starting .) for an executable file

element.name: GetExeExt.Result
element.short: Returns '.exe' in Windows, nothing in other systems.

element.name: ReadFileToString
element.short: ReadFileToString - returns a string with the contents of the named file

descr.p: ReadFileToString opens the file and reads its contents into a Stream, then reads the stream to construct the Result string.

element.errors: If there is an error in reading the file, an exception is raised and an empty string is returned.

element.name: ReadFileToString.Result
element.short: The contents of the file as a string, or an empty string if there is an error or the file is empty

element.name: ReadFileToString.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for processing

element.name: SearchFileInPath
element.short: SearchFileInPath - searches for Filename in the given SearchPath using the supplied BasePath with the specified Delimiter and the options listed in Flags

descr.p: Searches the whole path. Relative folder file names are expanded using BasePath. By default if BasePath is set it is searched as well, unless sffDontSearchInBasePath flag is present.
Returns the first file that matches the supplied criteria.

element.errors: If the file does not exist, an empty string is returned

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Result
element.short: Returns fully specified file name of the first file that matches the supplied criteria, or empty string if file not found

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for searching

element.name: SearchFileInPath.BasePath
element.short: The BasePath to be used for the search

element.name: SearchFileInPath.SearchPath
element.short: The path for searching

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Delimiter
element.short: The directory Delimiter to be used in the search

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Flags
element.short: Flags specifying how to search: e.g. don't search in base path, case independent search

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath
element.short: SearchAllFilesInPath - searches for all files named Filename in the given SearchPath using the supplied BasePath with the specified Delimiter and the options listed in Flags

descr.p: SearchAllFilesInPath searches the whole path unless the sffDontSearchInBasePath flag is present.
Returns all files that match the supplied criteria

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Result
element.short: Returns fully specified file names of all files that match the supplied criteria, or empty string if file not found

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for searching

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.BasePath
element.short: The BasePath to be used for the search

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.SearchPath
element.short: The path for searching

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Delimiter
element.short: The directory Delimiter to be used in the search

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Flags
element.short: Flags specifying how to search: e.g. don't search in base path, case independent search

element.name: FindDiskFilename
element.short: FindDiskFilename - finds the file that best fits the supplied filename

descr.p: FindDiskFilename - finds the file that best fits the supplied filename. Searches for the filename case on disk. The file must exist.
For example: If Filename='file' and there is only a 'File', then 'File' will be returned.

element.name: FindDiskFilename.Result
element.short: Returns the best fitting filename from the disk (taking case into consideration)

element.name: FindDiskFilename.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive
element.short: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive - searches for the given FileName in a case insensitive manner

element.name: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive.Result
element.short: If it exists, returns the file name with path information otherwise returns an empty string

element.name: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for processing

element.name: FindDefaultExecutablePath
element.short: FindDefaultExecutablePath - finds the default path to the named Executable file

descr.p: FindDefaultExecutablePath - finds the default path to the named Executable file. On Windows systems, it looks for files both with and without the '.EXE' extension.
If Executable is not an absolute filename the executable is searched using the environment variable PATH. Relative directories in PATH are expanded using BaseDir.
On non-Unix systems (e.g. Windows), it searches in BaseDir as well. While on Unix systems (e.g. Linux, OS X) it only searches in BaseDir, if PATH contains the '.' directory.

element.name: FindDefaultExecutablePath.Result
element.short: Returns the filename of the Executable file with path information attached

element.name: FindDefaultExecutablePath.Executable
element.short: The name of the Executable file

element.name: TFileIterator
element.short: Class for getting info about found file or directory.

element.name: TFileIterator.Stop
element.short: Stops the searching process.

element.name: TFileIterator.IsDirectory
element.short: If the current file is directory.

element.name: TFileIterator.FileName
element.short: Gets the current file name.

element.name: TFileIterator.FileInfo
element.short: Gets the current file info.

element.name: TFileIterator.Level
element.short: Gets the current file path level relative to base search path.

element.name: TFileIterator.Path
element.short: Gets the current file path.

element.name: TFileIterator.Searching
element.short: If the searching is in process.

element.name: TFileSearcher
element.short: Class for searching files
element.descr: TFileSearcher is a TFileIterator descendant used to search for files that match s search mask in a given directory path.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Create
element.short: Creates new file searcher object

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search
element.short: Searches for files in specified path with passed options

descr.p: Searches for files in the specified path. When a matching file is found, the OnFileFound event is invoked. For directories, the OnDirectoryFound event is signalled. You can abort the search process by calling the Stop method in either of these events.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.ASearchPath
element.short: Base path for searching files

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.ASearchMask
element.short: Mask used to determine file names that match in the search

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.ASearchSubDirs
element.short: Indicates if sub directories are searched recursively

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.CaseSensitive
element.short: Indicates if file names are compared using case sensitivity

element.name: TFileSearcher.MaskSeparator
element.short: Character used as a delimiter between file masks in the search critera

element.name: TFileSearcher.PathSeparator
element.short: Character used as a delimiter between directory paths in the search criteria

element.name: TFileSearcher.FollowSymLink
element.short: Indicates if a search should follow paths that are symbolic links

element.name: TFileSearcher.FileAttribute
element.descr: FileAttribute is a Word property. The default value for the property is faAnyfile.

element.name: TFileSearcher.DirectoryAttribute
element.descr: DirectoryAttribute is a Word property. The default value for the property is faDirectory.

element.name: TFileSearcher.OnDirectoryFound
element.short: Is invoked when directory is found.

element.name: TFileSearcher.OnFileFound
element.short: Is invoked when file is found.

element.name: TFileSearcher.OnDirectoryEnter
element.short: Event handler signalled when the searcher enters a new directory

element.name: TListFileSearcher
element.short: Stores file matching a search criteria in a TStrings class instance
element.descr: TListFileSearcher is a TFileSearcher descendant used to used store files matching a specified search criteria in a TStrings class instance.

element.name: TListFileSearcher.FList
element.short: Internal list used to store matching file names in the file searcher

element.name: TListFileSearcher.DoFileFound
element.short: Performs actions required to add a file name to the list of matches for the file searcher

element.name: TListFileSearcher.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance
element.descr: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor, and stores the TStrings instance in AList to the the internal member used in the class instance.

element.name: TListFileSearcher.Create.AList
element.short: TStrings class instance used to store matching file names

element.name: TListDirectoriesSearcher
element.short: Stores directory names matching a search criteria in a TStrings class instance
element.descr: TListDirectoriesSearcher is a TFileSearcher descendant used to store directory names matching the specified search criteria in a TStrings class instance.

element.name: TListDirectoriesSearcher.FDirectoriesList
element.short: Stores directory paths matching the specified search criteria

element.name: TListDirectoriesSearcher.DoDirectoryFound
element.short: Performs actions needed to add a directory path to the list of matches for the searcher

element.name: TListDirectoriesSearcher.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance
element.descr: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor, and stores the value in AList to the internal member used to capture matching directory names in the class instance.

element.name: TListDirectoriesSearcher.Create.AList
element.short: TStrings class instance used to store directory names matching the specified search criteria

element.name: FindAllFiles
element.short: Returns the list of files in the specified path matching the search criteria

descr.p: FindAllFiles is an overloaded method used to populate a TStringList class instance with a list of files match the specified search criteria. The procedure variant uses an existing TStringList class instance to store the matching file names. The function variant creates the TStringList class instance used as the return value for the method.

element.name: FindAllFiles.Result
element.short: List of file names matching the search criteria
element.descr: The StringList is created in the FindAllFiles function; you should not instantiate it before calling the function.

element.name: FindAllFiles.AList
element.short: TStringList used to store file names matching the search criteria
element.descr: AList must be instantiated before it is passed as an argument to the method. The TStringList instance must also be freed by the routine where it was created.

element.name: FindAllFiles.SearchPath
element.short: Base path for searching files

element.name: FindAllFiles.SearchMask
element.short: A list of masks, separated by a semicolon (;) to which found files should match
element.descr: A list of masks, separated by a semicolon (;) to which found files should match. The mask can contain wildcards like * and ? and it also supports sets like [a-d,x]. See the Masks unit for more details.

element.name: FindAllFiles.SearchSubDirs
element.short: If search recursively sub directories

element.name: FindAllFiles.PathSeparator
element.short: If search recursively sub directories

element.name: FindAllDirectories
element.short: Stores directory names matching the search criteria in a TStringList class instance

descr.p: FindAllDirectories is an overloaded routine used to store directory path names that match the specified search criteria in a TStringList class instance. The procedure variant uses an existing TStringList class instance to store the matching directory names. The function variant allocates a TStringList class instance used to capture the matching directory names.

element.name: FindAllDirectories.Result
element.short: Stores directory names matching the search criteria

element.name: FindAllDirectories.AList
element.short: Stores directory names matching the search criteria

element.name: CopyFile
element.short: CopyFile - copies Source file to Destination file, optionally preserving the timestamp of the original file
element.errors: An exception is raised if the copy process does not complete successfully or correctly.

element.name: CopyFile.Result
element.short: Returns True if successful, False if there was an error

element.name: CopyFile.SrcFilename
element.short: The source filename for the Copy

element.name: CopyFile.DestFilename
element.short: The destination filename for the Copy

element.name: CopyFile.PreserveTime
element.short: If True, the timestamp of the original file is preserved in the copied file

element.name: PascalFileExt
element.short: PascalFileExt - typically '.pas', '.pp' or '.p'

element.name: PascalSourceExt
element.short: An array of file extensions considered to be Pascal source code

element.name: AllDirectoryEntriesMask
element.short: File masked used to match all directories entries
